description.narrative: The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) works worldwide to provide humanitarian help for people affected by conflict and armed violence and to promote the laws that protect victims of war. An independent and neutral organization, its mandate stems essentially from the Geneva Conventions of 1949. Based in Geneva, Switzerland, it employs some 12,000 people in 80 countries; it is financed mainly by voluntary donations from governments and from national Red Cross and Red Crescent societies. Funding under this initiative provides multi-year funding for their including core, thematic and country program (Africa and Middle East and North Africa) funding. The total value of this initiative is $110.0 million over 4 years, starting 2017-18.
